resources.string: The account permission is required to access to the list of Google account on the device, in order to setup the connection with Google Drive.
Double encryption failed. Your database has been kept without modification
Automatic backups include all your oneSafe items, as well as Bubbles content.
Most secure in-app camera (based on CameraX technology).\nLimited features.

The oneSafe adventure started in 2011!

We strive to create an ultra-secure mobile safe that protects your digital life, while doing our best to keep it easy to use.

oneSafe 6 is the latest version of oneSafe, and will be enriched with new features very regularly.

We are delighted to have you among our users üíô
Come chat with the community on our Discord server!

import %d items

resources.string: Choose the Google account to use for cloud backup on Google Drive

Thank you for being a beta tester of oneSafe 6! You have the crash reports via Firebase in this version so that we can investigate and fix problems. No analytics, only crash reports, for your privacy.\n\nIf you have any feedback, please let us know on Discord.
Organize and customize your safe for an efficient and cool experience.
oneSafe is your safe for all your sensitive and confidential data. Everything is encrypted and ultra secure.
No servers, no data collection, no tracking. oneSafe ensures uncompromising protection of your privacy and data.
This is a oneSafe 6 backup file.\n\nYou can easily import is by choosing oneSafe 6 in sharing options
This is a oneSafe 6 sharing file.\n\nYou can easily import is by choosing oneSafe 6 in sharing options
If the problem persists, you can tell us about it on Discord.\nError: %s
The automatic backup has been completed
An error occurred during the automatic backup. Code %s
The automatic backup is in progress

You can set a special password to destroy oneSafe when you enter it instead of the master password.\n\nIt will display a ‚Äúwrong password‚Äù error to avoid displaying on the screen what happened, if you are observed.

You have set a special password to destroy this safe‚Äôs content when you enter it instead of the master password.\n\nIt will display a ‚Äúwrong password‚Äú error to avoid displaying on the screen what happened, if you are observed.

This feature will allow you to use oneSafe to autofill your login credentials on websites and apps.
Your backup file has been successfully created with your master password. \n\nWhat do you want to do now ?

Your backup file will contain **all your oneSafe items (%1$d)** and **Bubbles conversations (%2$d)**.\nWe will **secure** this file by encrypting it with your credentials.
All the items have been permanently removed
When you move items into the bin, they will appear in this section.\n\nYou can then restore them or delete them permanently.
Items in the bin will be deleted automatically after 30 days.
All items in the bin will be permanently deleted.\nDo you confirm this permanent deletion?
All items in the bin will be restored.\nDo you confirm this restoration?
All the items have been restored
Browse open items to return to them more quickly.
With oneSafe K (keyboard), you can communicate in any mobile app with your contacts in an ‚Äúencrypted bubble‚Äù, right from your keyboard.
Now you can communicate with %s securely in oneSafe!
We can‚Äôt decrypt some of the information in this contact.
If you delete this contact, data associated with this contact and conversation will also be removed.
Are you sure you want to delete this contact?
Better data security without the use of deeplink, but less simple to use: your contact will have to copy and paste encrypted messages or use oneSafe K on Android
You are waiting for a response to your invitation from **%s** to finalize the creation of the secure contact
Are you sure you want to delete this conversation and associated contact?
You have invited %s to a secure exchange.\n\nOnce this contact accepts the invitation, you can chat in a completely encrypted and secured way together.
Very secure, but less fluid. Your contact will have to import the archive into oneSafe, or use oneSafe K.
More fluid, your caller will be automatically redirected to oneSafe
More secure but less fluid. Your correspondent will have to copy/paste his messages into oneSafe, or use oneSafe K
Paste the encrypted message you received here
Impossible to decipher the message. Was it addressed to you?
Before you can chat in super secure bubbles, you need to add your first contacts in oneSafe.
This message has already been decrypted
You are trying to decrypt a message you sent
No contact matching the encrypted message
Make %s scan this QR code to complete the addition to your contacts
Or send her/him the invitation response.
Or send her/him the invitation link
Make %s scan this QR code to add her/him to your contacts
You don‚Äôt have a contact yet üòä
Bubbles is a oneSafe feature to exchange in any mobile App in an ultra-secure way with your contacts in an ‚Äúencrypted bubble‚Äù.
Before having conversations here, you have to invite contacts.
You have just received an encrypted message. To be able to use this feature, activate the ‚ÄúBubbles‚Äù feature in the settings
You can also accept someone‚Äôs invitation by scanning his QR Code.
Scan the QR code presented by your contact
Camera permission required to scan invitation
Permission to use the camera is required to scan the invitation QR code
Select the Bubbles conversation to send **%s** to.
Select the Bubbles conversation in which to send **%1$s** and its %2$s sub-items
The item has been successfully sent to the conversation

oneSafe Bubbles allows you to communicate in an ultra-secure way with your contacts, via all mobile apps you like (e.g. Telegram, Instagram, your Mail app, etc.).\n\nBubbles leverages the super strong Double Ratchet protocol to secure each of your messages.
We secure all your conversations, across all messaging apps.
You are about to delete all messages of this conversation. Do you confirm?
Do you really want to delete this message?
To reset the security of this conversation, you have to send a special message to %s. You‚Äôll have to wait for the response to continue the conversation.
This message is too old to be resent
In some rare cases, we can‚Äôt detect whether you really shared the message to the recipient, and you will be asked to confirm.

Ability to resend an encrypted message

Photos taken via the oneSafe app are secure. They will not be saved on your device or shared with any service.
The password must be different from your other safes
The new password must be different from the previous one.
Re-enabling biometrics is required after a password update.
The new password must be different from the previous one and from your other safes, if any.

This feature will allow you to access oneSafe items through Spotlight, iOS search function.\nüîí By authorizing Spotlight, you are limiting Spotlight to have only access to your item‚Äôs name and icon (and optionally to its identifier field, if defined).\nWithout permission, Spotlight does not access or store any data related to your oneSafe items.

resources.string: Know more about the item identifier

The item identifier has 2 uses:
- It is used with the **autofill** when connecting to a site or another app.
- It allows you to **distinguish similar items**.

It appears in the description of the item when displayed in list mode.

If you lost the double encryption key, you can import a backup.\nDouble encryption will be automatically disabled.\nYou can activate it again in the settings.

The encryption keys used by oneSafe are encrypted by the Android Keystore, which is a secure area on your smartphone.

However, the content of this Keystore can be deleted by Android under certain specific conditions, including migration from one smartphone to another (but not only).

Your Keystore has been deleted by Android. The key provided at the time of over-encryption must therefore be entered again.

oneSafe K allows you to encrypt and decrypt your most secret messages in all your applications, especially messaging Apps. For an even more secure digital life üôÇ.
You can open oneSafe K with your smartphone‚Äôs biometrics

With oneSafe K (keyboard), you can use oneSafe Bubbles directly in your keyboard, in any mobile App.

Automatic lock in case of inactivity
To work, oneSafe K needs the Android accessibility service.\n\nTo activate it, choose oneSafe K from the list that Android will show you after pressing:
You can start using oneSafe K now with the **same oneSafe 6 master password ‚úåÔ∏è**
For the oneSafe K keyboard to appear, you must switch to it in the screen that Android will show you after pressing:
To be able to decrypt a message from one of your contacts, you are going to add it to your clipboard by copying it.\n\noneSafe will notify you when the message is available.
With oneSafe K (keyboard), you can communicate in any mobile app with your contacts in an ‚Äúencrypted bubble‚Äù, right from your keyboard.\n\nYou must now configure oneSafe K with **2 quick steps**.
Start a secure bubble and exchange encrypted messages with:
You can lock oneSafe K whenever you want by pressing this button. Depending on your preferences set in oneSafe, you will also have automatic locking.
Open oneSafe K to send your first encrypted message!
You can send your first message to %s üöÄ!\nAnd you can retrieve his encrypted messages here via the different Apps you use to communicate, simply by copying them to your clipboard.
For security reasons, we recommend that you make a local backup before activating double encryption

oneSafe will restart at the end of the maneuver
Disabling encryption of the current database is on-going. Keep the app open.
Double encryption is enabled on your device.\n\nYou can deactivate it at any time.
A second layer of security is available. It consists of encrypting your database with a second key.
‚ö†Ô∏è Be careful, this double security will slow down the performance of your app by approximately 20%% (the more secure it is, the longer it takes to decrypt).
Your application will restart.\nDid you save this key correctly? You won‚Äôt be able to find it once encryption starts.
Double encryption failed. Your database has been kept without modifications.\nError: %s
Your safe will be encrypted with a second key.\nStore this key carefully outside of oneSafe! You may be asked for it again.

Double encryption in progress. Keep the app open.

The widget does not have ‚ÄúPanic mode‚Äù enabled.\n\nOnce enabled, if you tap 5x on the widget in the bottom right colored corner, all content of oneSafe will be deleted.

oneSafe is a free app that we created to secure the digital lives of as many people as possible.\n\nSo if you like oneSafe, there are two things you can do ü§©: talk about it around you, and tell us what you think! üíô
Do you like oneSafe and want to support us? You could give us a rating on the Store and a nice review ‚úåÔ∏è

%s has been removed from your favorites

Many new features: 1) the multi-safe to organize your items in different safes, 2) sharing of items via Bubbles to your contacts, 3) Bubbles data and crypto in your backup, 4) and now a special password for self-destruction of a safe, 5) a warning to make sure you have the password reminder activated, and you made a backup in the last 30 days.

Thank you for being a beta tester of oneSafe 6 üíô! In this version, you have the crash reports via Firebase, so that we can investigate and fix problems. No analytics, only crash reports, for your privacy.
Improvements of ‚ÄúoneSafe Bubbles‚Äú, the best way to communicate securely with your contacts, via all mobile apps you like.
Thanks to biometrics to open oneSafe, you might have forgotten your master password.\n\nWhy not checking now that you still remember it? ü§ì
Enter your master password to make sure you still remember it!
This widget allows you to launch oneSafe and also use the panic mode to delete some of your safes.

This is a preview of what you will send to your contact. The objective is to illustrate the type of encrypted message you will send.\n\noneSafe Bubbles leverages the Double Ratchet protocol to encrypt these messages: the final keys used to encrypt this message will be generated last minute when you decide to send this message. So the final encrypted message will be different from this preview.
It‚Äôs not your correct master password. If you forgot it, you can still change it!
